intro: Scleria puzzolanea, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. Scleria puzzolanea thrives in wet or marshy environments, often found in swampy areas or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
